title: Azir pros and cons?
body: I'm thinking of getting Azir for mid lane, so I was wondering what you guys think of him especially with the recent buffs. What are his pros and cons and do you like or dislike, why or why not?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=JonahGreen,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=lPxihAu4,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2014-12-15T02:38:07.573+0000)
> bump

The boards prevents bumping anymore unfortunately friend. New comments on posts don't bring them up to the front page.
RIP Forums.

He's an interesting champ to play - 
Even if he's not the strongest pick he will give you an enjoyable game.

He doesn't seem to have a lot of counters from what I have played of him (although {{champion:61}} hits a strike every time).
As some have said he has a weak early game especially due to being completely useless without mana.
His poke is godlike - especially while no one really knows how to play against him yet.
His zoning abilities are amazing - played right you can completely zone the enemy out of exp range while you free farm.

He tends to have an issue that he pushes too hard so you'll often find yourself further in that is comfortable - fortunately his kit allows him some great escapes and makes him hard to gank.

He's one of those champs that played right can turn games around, but he's not easy to play right.

As a general rule - I'd say get him - hell even if you don't like him at least you'll learn to better play against him.

This is opinionated by me, just from playing him myself.{{champion:268}} 
I personally don't favour playing Azir, just because of his unique playstyle, which isn't really my style, and I think it just takes a little too long to get the ball rolling

Pros: 
- Very strong damage output and poke late game (Like damn big damages)
- Good zoning etc with ult and soldiers
- Good teamfight initiation potential and contribution as well
- Strong disengage as well if need be


Cons:
- Still can be very, very buggy, with his ult and just generally, although most have been fixed now
- Weak early game (has been improved with buffs, but still a bit shaky in laning phase)
- Hard to play and hard to master (lots of practice, my friend)
- Hard to micro manage all of your soldiers while still being aware of your surroundings, which is a little hard to explain in detail but that sums up most of it (imagine Oriana's ball but up to three of them, whilst looking at the minimap, where your enemy is positioned and much more)
